poem:
### Exit Strategy

In the flicker of inbox lights,  
a digital ax swings wide—  
three million ghosts in echoing halls,  
their silence offered us in trade.  
February's shadow stretches thin,  
beneath star-spangled ceilings,  
as empty desks mourn the steady hum—  
while whispered dreams of futures dim.
